sen.j: 丹後由良駅（たんごゆらえき）は、京都府宮津市由良にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道（KTR）北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Yura, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, Tango-Yura Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Tango-Yura Station, located in Yura, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Tango-Yura Station, located in Yura, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, provided with two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.
Situated on the ground level, it has two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.
Situated on the ground level, it has two separate platforms with two tracks served between them.

sen.j: ヨットの帆をイメージした駅舎が特徴的。
sen.e: The station house thtat is designed imaging a sail is impressive.
The station house, which is designed to suggest a sail, is impressive.
The station house, which is designed to suggest a sail, is impressive.
Use situations
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約121人である。
sen.e: The number of persons getting on board at this station is approx. 121 a day in the fiscal 2006.
In fiscal 2006 the average daily number of boarders at this station was 121.
In fiscal year 2006 the average daily number of boarders at this station was 121.
(From statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(From statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 周辺に海水浴場を抱えていることもあって、夏の海水浴シーズンになると、特に海水浴客で大賑わいとなる。
sen.e: With sea-bathing beaches located nearby, this station is thronged particularly with sea-bathers in the summer sea-bathing season.
With sea-bathing beaches located nearby, this station is thronged particularly with beachgoers in the summer season.
With sea-bathing beaches located nearby, this station is thronged particularly with beachgoers in the summer season.

sen.j: 普段は通学・買い物客が大半を占め、主に舞鶴都市圏に属するため舞鶴市への利用が多い。
sen.e: Normally, users of this station, who are mostly students and shoppers, use it to go to Maizuru City because the area around the station belongs to the city area of Maizuru effectively.
Normally, users of this station, who are mostly students and shoppers, use it to go to Maizuru City because the area around the station effectively belongs to the city area of Maizuru.
Normally, users of this station, who are mostly students and shoppers, use it to go to Maizuru City because the area around the station effectively belongs to the city area of Maizuru.

History
History
History

sen.j: 1923年4月12日 日本国有鉄道峰山線の舞鶴（現在の西舞鶴）～宮津間開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: April 12, 1923: Operation of this station started when Japanese National Railways started its operaton the portion between Maizuru (present Nishimaizuru) and Miyazu of its Mineyam Line.
April 12, 1923: The station began operating when Japanese National Railways started running the portion between Maizuru (the present-day Nishimaizuru) and Miyazu on its Mineyama Line.
April 12, 1923: The station began operating when Japanese National Railways started running the portion between Maizuru (the present-day Nishi-Maizuru) and Miyazu on its Mineyama Line.

sen.j: 1932年8月10日 路線名改称により国鉄宮津線の駅に。
sen.e: August 10, 1932: The name of the railway line was changed to Miyazu Line, and it became a station on the Miyazu Line.
August 10, 1932: The railway line was renamed as the Miyazu Line, and it became a station on the Miyazu Line.
August 10, 1932: The railway line was renamed as the Miyazu Line, and it became a station on the Miyazu Line of the Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: Japan National Railwaysを追加しました。

sen.j: 1987年4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privitization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 1990年4月1日 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1990 - The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of the railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of that railway company.
April 1, 1990: The Miyazu Line was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway, and it became a station of that railway company.
